intro: Mariscus wrightii, commonly known as Wright's mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Mariscus wrightii is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
